title.rendered: Introducing Jim Price: Johnson Consulting Group’s New Senior Vice President, Industry Relations

content.rendered:
Scottsdale, AZ [January 8th, 2024]

Johnson Consulting Group adds new team member, Jim Price, as Senior Vice President, Industry Relations.

Johnson Consulting Group proudly welcomes Mr. Jim Price, a distinguished professional with an unparalleled career spanning over five decades in the funeral and cemetery profession. Price’s strategic acumen and proven success record position him as a coveted member in our consultancy team.

His impactful journey in the funeral and cemetery sector is a testament to his extraordinary contributions to the profession. Notably, he served as Senior Vice President, Industry Relations at Park Lawn Corporation for over 6 years, leaving an indelible mark on the organization’s strategic growth and success. Additionally, he held the role of Chief Executive Officer at Midwest Memorial Group for over 3 years, showcasing his dedication and leadership.

A luminary in the field, Price co-founded Foundations Partners Group, playing a pivotal role in its success and contributing to operational excellence and strategic initiatives. His 14-year tenure as Chief Operating Officer and Co-Founding Partner at Keystone Group Holdings, INC., further solidifies his legacy of exceptional leadership and sustained growth.

Jake Johnson, CEO of Johnson Consulting Group, expressed enthusiasm about the addition, stating, “Jim and I go way back to the days of Pierce Brothers Mortuaries and Keystone Group, I’m humbled that Jim would join our team.  Jim’s dedication and hard work in this profession will continue to flourish through his role at Johnson Consulting Group.”

Price has served the ICCFA Educational Foundation as chairman and President since 2015. He will be receiving their annual Lasting Impact Award on April 12th at the 2024 Annual Convention and Expo in Tampa, Florida. In 2022, Price was awarded the association’s Hall of Fame award. Price also currently serves on the National Board of Directors of the National Alliance for Children’s Grief (NACG), and the Advisory Board of the Center for the Study of Ethics/Sykes Business College at The University of Tampa.

Price’s appointment marks a significant milestone for Johnson Consulting Group, reinforcing our commitment to delivering top-tier business solutions to the funeral and cemetery profession. His wealth of experience and strategic insights are poised to make a lasting impact on our clients and the entire organization.

 

About Johnson Consulting Group:

Johnson Consulting Group is dedicated to providing comprehensive business solutions and tools to achieve heightened performance, profitability, and success within the funeral and cemetery industry. Our expert services encompass Succession Planning, selling funeral homes and cemeteries, financing solutions, business coaching, accounting services, business performance analysis, customer survey programs, Customer Experience workshops, incentive compensation plans, and Leadership and Management training.
